articles.author: Noel Randewich, Shristi A
articles.description: Wall Street stocks rose on Monday, with the Nasdaq jumping over 1% as Tesla surged on optimism around artificial intelligence and investors awaited inflation data due later this week.
articles.title: Wall Street rises on Tesla soars on AI optimism

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tesla rallied 6% on Monday after Morgan Stanley said its Dojo supercomputer could power a near $600 billion surge in the electric-car maker's market value by helping speed up its foray into robotaxis and software services.
articles.title: Tesla jumps as analyst predicts $600 bln value boost from Dojo

articles.author: Anirban Sen, Greg Roumeliotis, Ananya Mariam Rajesh
articles.description: J.M. Smucker (SJM.N) on Monday agreed to buy Twinkies maker Hostess Brands (TWNK.O) for $5.6 billion including debt in a deal that unites two major American snack makers.
articles.title: J.M. Smucker to buy Twinkies maker Hostess Brands in $5.6 billion deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Instacart is aiming for a valuation of up to $7.73 billion in its initial public offering in New York, the grocery delivery service said on Monday, in another step toward a hotly-anticipated listing.
articles.title: Grocery delivery app Instacart aims for up to $7.7 bln valuation in US IPO

articles.author: Blake Brittain
articles.description: A group of U.S. authors, including Pulitzer Prize winner Michael Chabon, has sued OpenAI in federal court in San Francisco, accusing the Microsoft-backed program of misusing their writing to train its popular artificial intelligence-powered chatbot ChatGPT.
articles.title: More writers sue OpenAI for copyright infringement over AI training

articles.author: Katherine Masters
articles.description: More than a dozen investors are calling on Nike to pay garment workers in Cambodia and Thailand that a labor rights group said lost wages after COVID-19 factory shutdowns, according to a Sept. 7 letter to Nike's CEO John Donahoe seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Nike urged to backpay garment workers ahead of annual meeting

articles.author: Stephen Nellis
articles.description: Qualcomm (QCOM.O) on Monday said it had signed a new deal with Apple (AAPL.O) to supply 5G chips to the iPhone maker until at least 2026.
articles.title: Qualcomm to supply Apple with 5G chips until 2026 under new deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Rescuers raced against time on Monday to find survivors in the rubble more than 48 hours after Morocco's deadliest earthquake in more than six decades, with more than 2,100 killed in a disaster that devastated villages in the High Atlas Mountains.
articles.title: Rescuers race to find survivors over 48 hours after Morocco quake

articles.author: Rajesh Prabhuswamy, Krishn Kaushik
articles.description: The Group of 20 major economies reached a hard-fought compromise over the war in Ukraine and papered over other key differences in a summit declaration at the weekend, presenting few concrete achievements in its core remit of responses to global financial issues.
articles.title: Analysis: G20 summit agrees on words but struggles on action

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Armenia and the United States began a joint military training exercise on Monday, a U.S. army spokesperson said, at a time of high tension in Armenian relations with neighbouring Azerbaijan.
articles.title: Armenia-U.S. military exercise kicks off near Yerevan - U.S. spokesperson
